description: Standalone Submodules Build - Enable each submodule to build/test independently via git dependencies while preserving root repo local development

userStories.title: Document git branch dependency strategy
userStories.description: As a maintainer, I want documented git dependency strategy so contributors understand how dependencies work in standalone vs root repo modes.
acceptanceCriteria: Create new section 'Dependency Resolution Strategy' in gsnake-specs/tasks/repo-architecture.md
Document git URL format for Rust: git = 'https://github.com/nntin/gsnake', branch = 'main', package = 'gsnake-core'
Document git URL format for JavaScript: git+https://github.com/nntin/gsnake.git#main:gsnake-core/engine/bindings/wasm/pkg
Document branch strategy: all git dependencies target main branch
Explain auto-detection mechanism: build scripts check for ../<submodule>/.git to detect root repo
Document root repo versioning (semver in package.json) vs submodule branch tracking
Include Rust and JavaScript git dependency examples
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Added comprehensive Dependency Resolution Strategy section to repo-architecture.md

userStories.title: Add troubleshooting section to architecture docs
userStories.description: As a developer, I want troubleshooting documentation so I can resolve common dependency issues.
acceptanceCriteria: Add 'Troubleshooting' section to gsnake-specs/tasks/repo-architecture.md
Document common issue: git dependency not found - check branch name and repo access
Document common issue: local override not working - verify ../.git detection logic
Document common issue: WASM build fails - ensure wasm32-unknown-unknown target installed
Document how to force standalone mode (ignore local overrides) for testing
Document how to verify which dependency mode is active
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Added comprehensive Troubleshooting section to repo-architecture.md

userStories.title: Update architecture diagram for dual dependency modes
userStories.description: As a maintainer, I want an updated Mermaid diagram showing both git and local path resolution.
acceptanceCriteria: Update Mermaid diagram in gsnake-specs/tasks/repo-architecture.md
Show conditional dependency resolution: git URLs (standalone) vs local paths (root repo)
Add visual distinction between standalone mode and root repo mode
Update pain points: mark 'cannot build alone' issues as resolved
Add legend explaining dependency resolution modes
Diagram renders correctly in markdown preview
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Updated Mermaid diagram showing dual modes with visual distinction and resolved pain points

userStories.title: Add gsnake-core standalone build validation
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to verify gsnake-core builds independently as the foundation for other submodules.
acceptanceCriteria: Verify gsnake-core can be cloned alone (git clone --no-recurse-submodules, then cd gsnake-core)
cargo build succeeds in standalone gsnake-core
cargo test succeeds in standalone gsnake-core
cargo doc --no-deps succeeds in standalone gsnake-core
wasm-pack build succeeds for wasm target (gsnake-core/engine/bindings/wasm)
Document any missing dependencies or issues found
Create gsnake-core/README.md with standalone build instructions if missing
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: All build commands validated successfully. README.md updated with comprehensive standalone build instructions.

userStories.title: Add gsnake-core CI workflow
userStories.description: As a developer, I want gsnake-core CI to validate standalone builds on every push.
acceptanceCriteria: Create gsnake-core/.github/workflows/ci.yml
Workflow triggers: push to main, pull_request, workflow_dispatch
Job 'build': checkout submodule only, install Rust, cargo build
Job 'test': checkout submodule only, install Rust, cargo test
Job 'wasm': checkout submodule only, install wasm-pack, build WASM target
Use standard actions: actions/checkout@v4, dtolnay/rust-toolchain@stable
Workflow runs successfully on GitHub Actions
Test locally with nektos/act: cd gsnake-core && act -j build
Document any act limitations in gsnake-core/README.md
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Created comprehensive CI workflow with build, test, and wasm jobs. Documented nektos/act usage and limitations in README.md.

userStories.title: Update gsnake-levels Cargo.toml with git dependency
userStories.description: As a developer, I want gsnake-levels to use git dependency for gsnake-core instead of path dependency.
acceptanceCriteria: Update gsnake-levels/Cargo.toml: replace path = '../gsnake-core' with git dependency
Git dependency format: gsnake-core = { git = 'https://github.com/nntin/gsnake', branch = 'main', package = 'gsnake-core' }
cargo build succeeds in standalone gsnake-levels (without sibling repos)
cargo test succeeds in standalone gsnake-levels
Remove any --manifest-path ../gsnake-core usage from scripts
cargo check passes with git dependency
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Updated Cargo.toml with git dependency. Added .cargo/config.toml for git-fetch-with-cli. Updated render.rs for graceful standalone handling. Documented in README.md.

userStories.title: Add local override detection to gsnake-levels
userStories.description: As a developer in root repo, I want gsnake-levels to auto-detect and use local gsnake-core.
acceptanceCriteria: Create gsnake-levels/build.rs or build script to detect root repo context
Detection logic: check if ../.git exists AND ../gsnake-core/.git exists
If root repo detected: create .cargo/config.toml with [patch.crates-io] or use CARGO_PATCH env var
Patch redirects git dependency to path = '../gsnake-core'
cargo build succeeds in root repo using local gsnake-core (verify with println! or check build logs)
cargo build still succeeds in standalone mode
Document override mechanism in gsnake-levels/README.md
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Created build.rs with auto-detection. Patches git dependency to use ../gsnake-core/engine/core in root repo. Documented in README.md.

userStories.title: Add gsnake-levels CI workflow
userStories.description: As a developer, I want gsnake-levels CI to validate standalone builds.
acceptanceCriteria: Create gsnake-levels/.github/workflows/ci.yml
Workflow triggers: push to main, pull_request, workflow_dispatch
Job 'build': checkout submodule only, install Rust, cargo build
Job 'test': checkout submodule only, install Rust, cargo test
Verify workflow uses git dependency (not local path)
Workflow runs successfully on GitHub Actions
Test locally with nektos/act: cd gsnake-levels && act -j build
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Created comprehensive CI workflow with build and test jobs. Documented nektos/act usage in README.md.

userStories.title: Commit WASM artifacts to gsnake-core for standalone builds
userStories.description: As a developer, I want prebuilt WASM in gsnake-core so gsnake-web can use it in standalone mode.
acceptanceCriteria: Build WASM: cd gsnake-core/engine/bindings/wasm && wasm-pack build
Verify pkg/ directory contains: package.json, .wasm, .js, .d.ts files
Remove pkg/ from .gitignore if present (allow committing build artifacts)
Commit gsnake-core/engine/bindings/wasm/pkg/* to git
Add note in gsnake-core/README.md: WASM pkg/ is committed for standalone builds
Verify pkg/package.json has correct name and version
Push to main branch
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Committed WASM artifacts (package.json, .wasm, .js, .d.ts). Updated .gitignore and README.md. Ready to push to main.

userStories.title: Update gsnake-web package.json with git dependency
userStories.description: As a developer, I want gsnake-web to use git dependency for WASM instead of file: path.
acceptanceCriteria: Update gsnake-web/package.json dependencies section
Replace 'gsnake-core': 'file:../gsnake-core/engine/bindings/wasm/pkg'
With: 'gsnake-core': 'git+https://github.com/nntin/gsnake.git#main:gsnake-core/engine/bindings/wasm/pkg'
npm install succeeds in standalone gsnake-web (without sibling repos)
Verify node_modules/gsnake-core contains WASM files
npm run build succeeds in standalone mode
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Simplified build scripts. Fixed WASM init. Kept file: path (npm doesn't support git subdirectory deps). US-011 will add detection.

userStories.title: Create local dependency detection script for gsnake-web
userStories.description: As a developer in root repo, I want gsnake-web to auto-detect and use local WASM.
acceptanceCriteria: Create gsnake-web/scripts/detect-local-deps.js
Script checks if ../../gsnake-core/.git exists (root repo context)
If detected: dynamically update package.json to use file:../gsnake-core/engine/bindings/wasm/pkg
If not detected: keep git dependency
Add preinstall script to package.json: node scripts/detect-local-deps.js
npm install succeeds in root repo using local WASM
npm install succeeds in standalone mode using git WASM
Document behavior in gsnake-web/README.md
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Created detection script with preinstall hook. Auto-detects root repo and configures dependency path. Documented in README.md.

userStories.title: Handle contract test fixtures in gsnake-web
userStories.description: As a developer, I want gsnake-web contract tests to work in standalone mode.
acceptanceCriteria: Identify contract fixture files needed (from gsnake-core/engine/core/tests/fixtures)
Copy required fixtures to gsnake-web/tests/fixtures or gsnake-web/src/__tests__/fixtures
Update test imports to use local fixtures instead of ../../gsnake-core paths
npm test succeeds in standalone gsnake-web
npm test succeeds in root repo
Add comment in fixtures: 'Copied from gsnake-core for standalone builds'
Document in gsnake-web/README.md: fixtures are duplicated for standalone mode
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Copied 8 fixtures with comments. Updated test imports. All tests pass. Documented in README.md.

userStories.title: Add gsnake-web CI workflow
userStories.description: As a developer, I want gsnake-web CI to validate standalone builds.
acceptanceCriteria: Create gsnake-web/.github/workflows/ci.yml
Workflow triggers: push to main, pull_request, workflow_dispatch
Job 'install': checkout submodule only, setup Node 20, npm ci
Job 'build': depends on install, npm run build
Job 'typecheck': depends on install, npm run check
Job 'test': depends on install, npm test
Use standard actions: actions/checkout@v4, actions/setup-node@v4
Cache node_modules for faster runs
Workflow runs successfully on GitHub Actions
Test locally with nektos/act: cd gsnake-web && act -j build
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Created CI workflow with build, typecheck, and test jobs. Node cache enabled. Documented nektos/act usage in README.md.

userStories.title: Add environment variable for gsnake-editor web URL

npm run build succeeds with GSNAKE_WEB_URL=https://example.com
